intro: Codonoboea reptans var. modesta, commonly known as the modest creeping codonoboea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale blue to violet flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is a popular choice among gardeners in mild climates.
